alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 30 at 1:39AM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwestA portion of southwest California, including the following counties, Los Angeles and Ventura. California, including the following counties, Los Angeles and Ventura. * WHEN...Until 345 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Ponding of water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to brief heavy rain in numerous showers. There is also a slight chance of thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.1 and 0.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, western Malibu, Ojai, Westlake Village, and Calabasas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
